instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.C1802: What is C1802? Capacitor to ground on PCH_SRTCRST_L on machines from 2009-2012, PCH_SRTCRST_L needs to be high for PCH to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.C1803: What is C1803? Capacitor to ground on RTC_RESET_L on machines from 2009-2012, RTC_RESET_L needs to be high for system to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .

threads.title: 3115-B Water Damage, Green light, no Fan
threads.message:
Hi,

Corrosion around <RESISTOR>R1801</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1802</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1803</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR>. Replaced them and fixed broken lines between them but still doesnt turn on.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.6V

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.48V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3V

<SIGNAL>P3V3S5_ENTRIP</SIGNAL> 0.71V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 140 diode mode. Does that mean I have short to ground?

Thanks!

threads.title: 3115-B Water Damage, Green light, no Fan
threads.message:
No short at all.Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>?
Check all (4) RTC signals at page 16.

threads.title: 3115-B Water Damage, Green light, no Fan
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> - 0V

<SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTC</SIGNAL> - 0.38V

<SIGNAL>RTC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - totally corroded

pulled a wire from <CAPACITOR>C1803</CAPACITOR> to <RESISTOR>R1803</RESISTOR> and voila, its alive again!

Thanks for you help man. You helped me fix 2 motherboards today +100 to your karma!
